decks.notes: This Jeskai Control deck focuses on card advantage, removal, and board control to outvalue opponents and stall the game until it can unleash powerful spells like Jeskai Revelation. The deck includes a variety of versatile removal spells like Lightning Helix and Abrade, as well as card draw options like Meticulous Archive and Consult the Star Charts. Floodfarm Verge and Riverpyre Verge help fix mana while No More Lies and Stock Up provide additional card advantage. The deck also includes some powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Island','','');">The Unagi of Kyoshi Island to close out games.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board with creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Spyglass Siren while using spells such as Stab and Shoot the Sheriff to eliminate threats. The deck also includes cards like Tishana's Tidebinder and Bitter Triumph to maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategies. By combining efficient creatures with powerful removal and disruption, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use efficient creatures and spells to build a strong board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The deck focuses on utilizing creatures like Llanowar Elves and Gene Pollinator to ramp up mana quickly and play powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. The inclusion of cards like Nature's Rhythm and Quantum Riddler help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain momentum. By efficiently utilizing mana and deploying threats rapidly, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures like Llanowar Elves and Gene Pollinator, and use cards like Nature's Rhythm and Quantum Riddler to generate additional resources and tempo advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth and Marang River Regent to seal the deal once the aggression has been established. The inclusion of cards like Spider-Sense and Sentinel of Lost Lore provide some control and card advantage to keep the aggro going strong.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly curving out with efficient creatures like Ouroboroid and Llanowar Elves, while utilizing Gene Pollinator to generate additional threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and resilient threats like Overlord of the Balemurk. By incorporating removal spells like Shoot the Sheriff and Stab, as well as recursion with cards like Sentinel of Lost Lore, the deck can continue applying pressure even in the late game. Nature's Rhythm and Multiversal Passage provide additional versatility and mana fixing to ensure smooth gameplay.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a mix of spells and abilities to manipulate the board state and counter opponent's threats. It utilizes cards like Gran-Gran and Accumulate Wisdom to generate card advantage, while Combustion Technique and Firebending Lesson provide removal options. Monument to Endurance helps to stabilize the board, while cards like Spell Pierce and It'll Quench Ya! are used to counter opponent's spells. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and slowly grind out a victory through careful resource management and well-timed plays.

This deck focuses on controlling the board using a combination of spells and creature abilities in order to outlast the opponent. The key strategy involves utilizing card draw and removal to maintain card advantage, while also using powerful spells like Combustion Technique and Iroh's Demonstration to deal with threats. The deck also includes a mix of creature cards for added versatility and pressure. Overall, the goal is to establish control early on and secure victory through a combination of efficient removal, counter spells, and powerful finishers.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw. By utilizing cards like Boomerang Basics and Combustion Technique, the player can effectively deal with threats on the board while also maintaining card advantage through spells like Accumulate Wisdom and Artist's Talent. The inclusion of Iroh's Demonstration and Gran-Gran provides additional control tools, while cards like Abandon Attachments and Firebending Lesson can help to protect the player's own creatures. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through careful resource management.

This deck focuses on using reanimation spells and abilities to bring back powerful creatures such as Superior Spider-Man, Harvester of Misery, and Overlord of the Balemurk from the graveyard to the battlefield. By combining these creatures with cards like Analyze the Pollen and Bringer of the Last Gift, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and powerful combo. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth casting of spells and creatures, while also providing the necessary colors for the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with low-cost creatures like Llanowar Elves and Badgermole Cub, while using cards like Quantum Riddler and Nature's Rhythm to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes cards like Gene Pollinator and Spider Manifestation to generate additional threats, and has a finisher in Craterhoof Behemoth to quickly close out games. The inclusion of Multiversal Passage allows for fixing mana and ensuring smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive strategy while maintaining versatility through its card choices.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and counter spells. It utilizes cards like Gran-Gran, Combustion Technique, and Abandon Attachments to remove threats from the opponent's side while also using Accumulate Wisdom and Riverpyre Verge to draw more cards and maintain resources. The deck also includes cards like Firebending Lesson and Iroh's Demonstration to control the game tempo and finish off opponents with burst damage. With a mix of removal, card advantage, and finishing power, this control deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Badgermole Cub and Mockingbird. It also aims to ramp up mana using cards like Llanowar Elves and Botanical Sanctum to play powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Marang River Regent. The deck also includes cards like Quantum Riddler and Spider-Sense to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect its own creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on being fast and proactive, overwhelming opponents with its aggressive creatures and versatile spells.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on using a combination of card draw, removal spells, and counterspells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to stall the game with various land cards and removal spells until it can establish card advantage through cards like Consult the Star Charts and Meticulous Archive. Once the opponent's resources are depleted, the deck can close out the game with powerful finishers like Ultima and Jeskai Revelation. The inclusion of cards like Rest in Peace and Day of Judgment provides additional tools to deal with specific threats and clear the board when needed.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Willowrush Verge to play powerful creatures like Gene Pollinator and Quantum Riddler. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while disrupting their game plan using cards like Ouroboroid and Spider-Sense. The deck also utilizes cards like Mockingbird and Spider Manifestation to keep the board controlled and apply pressure. In the late game, cards like Craterhoof Behemoth and Surrak, Elusive Hunter can quickly finish off the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countering spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. The deck focuses on utilizing various instant and sorcery spells to control the board, gain card advantage, and ultimately outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Spell Pierce, Abrade, and Ral, Crackling Wit, the player can disrupt their opponent's game plan while also furthering their own by drawing additional cards with Accumulate Wisdom and utilizing powerful finishers like Firebending Lesson and Gran-Gran.

This Esper Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with lower cost creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Sunpearl Kirin, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Nowhere to Run and Boomerang Basics. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Aang, Swift Savior and Tinybones Joins Up to seal the deal. Additionally, it has a variety of control elements such as Stormchaser's Talent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base is well-balanced to ensure consistent access to all colors for optimal performance.
